humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The ancient farming tool of the oracle bone inscriptions is a kind of soil-producing tool developed from the pointed wooden stick used for digging plants or spotting in primitive agriculture. The short portrait of the stepped crossbar (Qiu Xigui) in the glyph. Plowing with agricultural tools requires strength, and extension means strength.

Later, "è€œ" was developed from force-shaped agricultural tools, and the force-shaped agricultural tools were changed from a narrow tip to a wide blade, and it became a wooden scorpion. In addition, the " Lei " and " force " (including the later " plow ") are two different tools, " Lei " under the manifold head, " force ", " plow " the next edge, " Lei " emulate branch-like tools , "è€œ" is a farm tool imitating the stick style (Qiu Xigui).

Oracle bone inscriptions are used as verbs, which means using Lei Lei to plow the soil. Bronze inscriptions have two meanings: one, expressing strength and strength, hanging the bell: "Spiritual power is like a tiger, and Jin (diligence) does its work." "Poetry. Bei Feng. "Jane Xi": "Strong like a tiger, and a reel like a team." Second, to express credit, Zhongshan Wangding: "A few people are worthy, and good."

"Shuowen": "The tendon is like a human tendon. To cure power is power, which can swallow a catastrophe. All power belongs to force." Duan Yucai's note quoted: "Can prevent catastrophes." The interpretation is incorrect.
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle like ancient farm tools, farming with farm tools requires strength, and the extension refers to strength.

Elaboration: The ancient farming tool of the oracle bone inscriptions is a kind of soil-producing tool developed from the pointed wooden stick used for digging plants or spotting in primitive agriculture. The short portrait of the stepped crossbar (Qiu Xigui) in the glyph. Plowing with agricultural tools requires strength, and extension means strength. Later, " è€œ" was developed from force-shaped agricultural tools, and the force-shaped agricultural tools were changed from a narrow tip to a wide blade, and it became a wooden scorpion. In addition, the " Lei" and " force" (including the later " plow") are two different tools, " Lei" under the manifold head, " force", " plow" the next edge, " Lei" emulate branch-like tools , " è€œ" is a farm tool imitating the stick style (Qiu Xigui). Oracle bone inscriptions are used as verbs, which means using Lei Lei to plow the soil. Bronze inscriptions have two meanings: one, expressing strength and strength, hanging the bell: "Spiritual power is like a tiger, and Jin (diligence) does its work." "Poetry. Bei Feng. "Jane Xi": "Strong like a tiger, and a reel like a team." Second, to express credit, Zhongshan Wangding: "A few people are worthy, and good." "Shuowen": "The tendon is like a human tendon. To cure power is power, which can swallow a catastrophe. All power belongs to force." Duan Yucai's note quoted: "Can prevent catastrophes." The interpretation is incorrect.

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[â‘ ]ï¼»lÃ¬ï¼½
["Guangyun" Lin Zhiqie, enter the post, come. ]
(1) Strength; strength.
(2) Ability.
(3) Power; power.
(4) This refers to the merits of law-making and governance, and later refers to merits in general.
(5) Labor; servants.
(6) Servants.
(7) Diligent, do your best.
(8) Very much.
(9) The strength unit of the bow.
(10) Physics terms. Refers to the interaction between substances. Any action that can make an object gain acceleration or deform is called force, such as collision force, friction force, electrostatic force, elastic force, universal gravitation, etc. The common units of force are Newtons, Dynes or grams, kilograms, etc.
(11) Last name. According to legend, after Huangdi Zuochen Limu. Han Youlizidu. See "The Book of the Later Han Â· The Biography of Ren Guang".
